Key Match Events: India won by 8 wickets against Ireland.
Rohit Sharma retired hurt on 52 with a shoulder injury.
India's fast bowlers dominated on a two-paced pitch.
Hardik Pandya took 3 wickets for 27 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh took 2 wickets each.
Rishabh Pant hit a reverse-paddle-scoop for six to win the match.
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma mentioned the uncertainty of the pitch conditions and the strategy to bowl first to understand the pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland captain Paul Stirling acknowledged the tough conditions and praised India's bowling attack.
India captain Rohit Sharma reflected on the importance of sticking to basics and the balance of the team.
Player of the match Jasprit Bumrah expressed satisfaction with the outcome and the adaptability of the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland struggled with the pitch conditions, leading to a poor batting display.
India's bowlers took advantage of the pitch conditions, leading to Ireland's low score.
